questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements is true regarding “v-if” and “v-show” directives in VueJS?
question_texts: Which of the following statements is true regarding “v-if” and “v-show” directives in VueJS?

options.option_text: The “v-if” directive adds/removes elements from the DOM, while v-show onlytoggles visibility using CSS.
The “v-show” directive adds/removes elements from the DOM, while v-if onlytoggles visibility using CSS.
Both the “v-if” and “v-show” directives add/remove elements from the DOM.
Both the “v-if” and “v-show” directives toggle visibility using CSS.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements is true about the let, const, and var keywords in JavaScript?
question_texts: Which of the following statements is true about the let, const, and var keywords in JavaScript?

options.option_text: var is block-scoped, while let and const are function-scoped.
const variables must always be initialized at the time of declaration.
Variables declared with let and const are hoisted and initialized withundefined.
let, const, and var have identical scoping rules.
